result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah E Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge due in 60 days.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Court waived requirement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah E Martin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9 p.m. and 7 a.m. 
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Moneecia A.
Trial Judge - Br 5

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
